dublin_core.dcvalue: At present medical applications applying World Wide Web WWW technology are mainly used to view static images and to retrieve some information The Java platform is a relative new way of computing especially designed for network computing and distributed applications which enables interactive connection between user and information via the WWW The Java 2 Software Development Kit SDK including Java2D API Java Remote Method Invocation RMI technology Object Serialization and the Java Advanced Imaging JAI extension was used to achieve a robust platform independent and network centric solution Medical image processing software based on this technology is presented and adequate performance capability of Java is demonstrated by an iterative reconstruction algorithm for single photon emission computerized tomography SPECT
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T12:20:27Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2001-01-02
Distributed nuclear medicine applications using World Wide Web and Java technology.
